forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. West southwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 3 to 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The air over Downtown San Francisco hangs heavy with the promise of rain, a cool chill wrapping around the early morning. While the clouds scatter above, a marine layer clings to the horizon, hinting at the moody artistic palette that often defines this city. Patches of fog lazily drift along the water, perhaps inching toward the iconic outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge, merging the line where earth meets sky in a soft, ethereal embrace. Today, the sun will offer just a fleeting glimpse before retreating to make way for the drumming of raindrops, expected to arrive later in the afternoon, with a palpable anticipation for their touch.

As the day unfolds, temperatures will sway from the mild comfort of the early morning into the low 60s, a signaling call for layers. A light jacket will serve as a companion against the brisk wind that sneaks in from the west, and sensible shoes are advisable for those venturing out, especially as the pavement begins to glisten under misting skies. Instead of lofty excursions, the day invites quieter pursuits; perhaps a stroll through the cozy nooks of a local bookstore or a languid afternoon tea in warm light, all while the clouds gather their strength, promising to join forces with the evening. This is a day for the simple pleasures, as the city readies itself for the resurgence of rain, transforming the streets into glistening reflections of muted colors.
